info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 07 at 6:10PM MDT until June 07 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT FOR NORTHEASTERN KIT CARSON COUNTY... At 609 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles south of Burlington, moving southeast at 30 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR BURLINGTON AND EASTERN KIT CARSON COUNTY. HAZARD...90 mph wind gusts and baseball size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 604 PM MDT...85 mph wind gusts were reported at the Burlington Airport. Two inch hail was reported earlier in Bethune. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged or destroyed. Homes and businesses will have substantial roof and window damage. Expect extensive tree damage and power outages. Locations impacted include... Burlington and Bethune. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 425 and 437. Highway 385 between mile markers 186 and 198. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...90 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
